title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
code: auth_from_secret(app_name, api_key, access_token, refresh_token, cache = FALSE)

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
text: app_name app trying authorize? 'google', 'calendly' 'github'? api_key calendly github, pass API key set going https://github.com/settings/tokens/new https://calendly.com/integrations/api_webhooks respectively. access_token Google, access token can obtained running authorize interactively: token <-authorize(); token$credentials$access_token refresh_token Google, refresh token can obtained running authorize interactively: token <-authorize(); token$credentials$refresh_token cache credentials cached? TRUE FALSE?

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
text: OAuth token saved environment package can use users' Google data

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
code: if (FALSE) {  # Example for authorizing Calendly # You go to https://calendly.com/integrations/api_webhooks to get an api key auth_from_secret("calendly", api_key = "A_calendly_api_key_here")  # Example for GitHub # You go to https://github.com/settings/tokens/new to get a Personal Access Token auth_from_secret("github", api_key = "ghp_a_github_pat_here")  # Example for authorizing for Google token <- authorize("google") auth_from_secret(   app_name = "google",   refresh_token = token$credentials$access_token,   access_token = token$credentials$refresh_token ) }
